snippet: On the same day an officer is arraigned on manslaughter charges for shooting Ramarley Graham, prosecutors will make closing arguments against his half-brothers, who are accused of gang activity.
abstract: Prosecutors are expected to begin closing arguments against Hodean and Kadean Graham, twin brothers facing criminal charges over alleged involvement in a Harlem gang; trial is taking place at same time that New York City Police Officer Richard Haste is to be indicted on manslaughter charges for killing the twins' half-brother Ramarley Graham; timing brings into sharp relief the odd juxtaposition of trials in which the family finds itself involved.
lead_paragraph: On the same day an officer is arraigned on manslaughter charges for shooting Ramarley Graham, prosecutors will make closing arguments against his half-brothers, who are accused of gang activity.

headline.seo: For Family of Bronx Teen Killed by Police, Two Trials to Juggle
headline.main: 2 Court Cases at Once for Family of Bronx Man Killed by the Police
headline.print_headline: 2 Court Cases at Once for Family of Bronx Man Killed by the Police
